result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole E. Schoephoerster

records.addlTxt: 8:34 AM Defendant Cole E. Schoephoerster in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court heard PH remains on calendar.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:42 AM Defendant Cole E. Schoephoerster in court.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
